Question: For each of the four part drawings in Figure P16.14, indicate which PM class the parts belong to, whether the part must be pressed from one or two directions, and how many levels of press control will be required. Dimensions are mm.
Answer: Answer. (a) Class II, 2 directions because of axial thickness, one level of press control. (b)	Class I, one direction part is relatively thin, one level of press control. (c)	Class IV, 2 directions of pressing, 3 levels of press control required. (d)	Class IV, 2 directions of pressing, 4 or 5 levels of press control due to multiple steps in part design.
